org.libav.audio

Class AudioStreamPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.libav.audio.AudioStreamPlayer

  • public class AudioStreamPlayer
extends Object
    Audio stream player. It provides audio playback via Java Sound API. It does not support audio mixing.
    Author:
    Ondrej Perutka

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AudioStreamPlayer(AudioInputStream inputStream, AudioFormat outputFormat)
      Create a new audio stream player, set the input stream and use a data line of the given format.
      AudioStreamPlayer(AudioInputStream inputStream, SourceDataLine dataLine)
      Create a new audio stream player and set the input stream and the data line.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the audio stream player and its data line.
      void flushDataLine()
      Flush the data line internal buffer.
      float getVolume()
      Get the currently set volume.
      void join()
      Wait until the playback stops.
      void play()
      Start audio playback.
      void setVolume(float volume)
      Set the output volume.
      void stop()
      Stop playback.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioStreamPlayer

        public AudioStreamPlayer(AudioInputStream inputStream,
                 SourceDataLine dataLine)
        Create a new audio stream player and set the input stream and the data line. The input stream and the data line do not have to use the same audio format, but the conversion must be supported if the audio formats are not same.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - an input stream
        dataLine - a data line
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the necessary conversion is not supported

      • AudioStreamPlayer

        public AudioStreamPlayer(AudioInputStream inputStream,
                 AudioFormat outputFormat)
                  throws LineUnavailableException
        Create a new audio stream player, set the input stream and use a data line of the given format. The input stream format and the data line format do not have to be the same, but the conversion must be supported if they are not.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - an input stream
        outputFormat - a data line format
        Throws:
        LineUnavailableException - if there is no data line for the given data line format
        IllegalArgumentException - if the necessary conversion is not supported

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
        Start audio playback.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop playback.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float volume)
        Set the output volume.
        Parameters:
        volume - a volume

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume()
        Get the currently set volume.
        Returns:
        currently set volume

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the audio stream player and its data line.

      • join

        public void join()
          throws InterruptedException
        Wait until the playback stops.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting

      • flushDataLine

        public void flushDataLine()
        Flush the data line internal buffer.
